textiles@btinternet com & see more of my designs at http //fionakelly wordpress com/ a b c 2 put all crocheted parts in your washing machine with an old pair of jeans & 2 x fairy liquitabs or other normal washing machine detergent quantity for a full load set washing machine to long- est cycle available without prewash with a minimum temperature of 90 degrees centigrade hottest wash after felting wash is complete remove items and reshape arms legs & head/face while still damp during the felting some of the mane chain loops may have matted together gently tease them apart where needed leave all pieces to dry naturally until completely dry do not tumble dry assembly instructions 1 with your chosen stuffing stuff stuff and stuff some more the head body & limbs thread sharp sew- ing needle with a double strand of the medium grey colour thread and knot the end ladder stitch head open- ing closed and pull stitches so tight that they disappear as in pictures d e & f tie ends off very securely d e f 2 thread sharp sewing needle with a double strand of the medium grey colour thread and knot the end identify left and right limbs & attatch to body by ladder stitching limbs in postition as above repeat ladder stitching for tail and for attaching head to body making sure to pull stitches so tight that they disappear each time tie ends off very securely 3 using a sharp pair of scissors cut through 4 using a double strand of kauni back stitch the apex of every felted mane & tail chain loops embroider his smiley mouth starting at bottom corner stretching the loop slightly to help achieve cut at of nose down & then heading out to the sides very top of each loop your lion is now completely finished & i hope you enjoyed making him page 7 copyright © 2008 fiona kelly make
